Title: Days on the Market
Body: On the Property record page, we have a component that displays the number of days a property has been on the market. This is a pretty important detail for sales reps!

Title: Component Reuse
Body: On the right, we reuse the map component that we have in Property Explorer. Reusability is a great benefit of a component-based development model.

Title: Mobile
Body: Dreamhouse sample app is designed to work nicely on mobile. Consider logging into the Salesforce Mobile app and checking it out!

Title: Wrapping It Up
Body: You've now completed the Dreamhouse sample app tour. We hope that you've enjoyed the trip! Take a look at VS Code's code tours to learn more about the app's code.

Title: Welcome to Dreamhouse Sample App!
Body: Dreamhouse is a fictitious real estate company that manages its properties and brokers using the Salesforce Platform.

Title: Property Explorer
Body:
Sales reps use the "Property Explorer" page to look for properties based on certain filters.

Change some filters on the left to filter properties. Then, click on any of the properties to see its details.

Title: App Builder
Body: This page is composed of Lightning web components arranged in App Builder. App Builder lets you easily reorganize components, change the page layout, add visibility filters and more.

Title: Lightning Message Service
Body: Components communicate using Lightning Message Service. This allows to craft loosely coupled, reusable components.

Title: Property List Component
Body: The component in the center of the screen retrieves a paginated and responsive list of properties. Try to resize the browser to verify it!

Title: lightning-map
Body: The map on the right is built using the lightning-map base component, a very handy way to show property locations.

Title: Next Tour
Body: Now, go to the Property Finder tab or click Next Tour to navigate to the next tour.

Title: Property Finder
Body: The "Property Finder" page is also composed in App Builder. This time we use a map to show filtered properties locations. Click on any of the map markers to select a property and see its details.

Title: Third party JavaScript libraries
Body: The map component in the center of the screen is built using a third party JavaScript library, provided as static resource.

Title: Next Tour
Body: Now, select a property. Click on the double arrow icon located next to the property's name in the property summary card. You'll navigate to the property record page and find the next tour.

Title: Introduce Yourself to Others
Body:
If you haven’t personalized your Chatter profile yet:


  1. To edit your Chatter Profile, click the avatar icon in the top-right corner, then click your name.
  2. To add a picture of yourself, click the placeholder avatar. 
  3. Click the pencil, and share your awesomeness with your colleagues on Chatter.

Title: Create Shortcuts to Favorite Pages
Body: To bookmark a page, click the star icon. You can use the dropdown from any page to access your favorites.

MasterLabel: Get Help Anywhere in the App
Title: Get Help Anywhere in the App
Body: To open the Help Menu, click the question mark. Find resources related to your work or search for answers to questions.

Title: Manage Your Records Easily
Body:
List views are a great way to sort, prioritize, and analyze the records that are most important to you. Get started with list views with these tips. 

  • Switch list views using the dropdown menu. 
  • Make your favorite list view the default by pinning it.
  • Use filters to tailor an existing list view to your needs.
  • Select which fields to display from the List View Controls menu. 
  • Get to the right record with search. 
  • Visualize your data with charts or the Kanban board.

Title: Get to Recent Items Quickly
Body:
Explore these ways to get to recent items.

  • Search box: As you type a search term. 
  • Navigation bar: From the dropdown next to items. 
  • Home page: In the Recent Records card (if available).

Title: Introduce Yourself to Others
Body:
If you haven’t personalized your Chatter profile yet:


  1. To edit your Chatter Profile, click your profile icon at the top of the page, then click your name.
  2. To add a picture of yourself, go to your profile and click the camera icon on the placeholder image. 
  3. Click the pencil, and share your awesomeness with your Chatter colleagues.

MasterLabel: Case List Create Shortcuts To Favorite Pages
Title: Create Shortcuts to Favorite Pages
Body: To bookmark a page, click the star icon. You can use the dropdown from any page and access your favorites..

Body: To open the Help Menu, click the question mark. Find resources related to your work or search for answers to questions.

List views are a great way to sort, prioritize, and analyze the records that are most important to you. Get started with list views with these tips. 

  • Switch list views using the dropdown menu. 
  • Make your favorite list view the default by pinning it.
  • Use filters to tailor an existing list view to your needs.
  • Select which fields to display from the List View Controls menu.

  • Visualize your data with charts or the Kanban board.

Body:
Explore these ways to get to recent items.

  • Search box: When you click in the search field.
  • Home page: In the Recent Records card (if available).

MasterLabel: Lighting Experience - Get Your Bearings Step 1
Title: Let’s explore your new workspace
Body: Lightning Experience may seem different than what you’re used to, but Salesforce Classic core features made the journey with you. Get your bearings with this quick tour and video at the end.

MasterLabel: Lighting Experience - Get Your Bearings Step 2
Title: Get help anywhere you need it
Body: Go to the header of any page and click the question mark to open the Help Menu. It’s a curated list of resources that are specific to the page you’re on and the actions you can do there.

MasterLabel: Lighting Experience - Get Your Bearings Step 3
Title: Find your profile and settings
Body: Click on the avatar in the top right corner to open the profile menu and click your name to get to your profile page. Take a moment to update your picture and banner.

MasterLabel: Lighting Experience - Get Your Bearings Step 4
Title: Create shortcuts to favorite pages
Body: To bookmark frequently-used records, lists, and groups, click the star icon in the header. Use the dropdown next to the star from any page and access your favorites.

MasterLabel: Lighting Experience - Get Your Bearings Step 5
Title: Take Lightning Experience for a spin
Body: Now that you know the basics, watch this short video to explore more about your new workspace. Thanks for taking this tour with us!

Title: Ready...set...find your records
Body: Navigating in Lightning Experience is simple. Let’s go over the quickest way to find what you need.

Title: Switching apps is a breeze
Body: Use the App Launcher (nine dots icon, top left) to quickly change apps. Or, search for any app, object, or item that you have permission to use.

Title: Your home base for navigating around
Body: Use the navigation bar to access objects, the main Chatter feed, groups, reports and dashboards, and the other major features you use.

Title: Personalize your navigation bar
Body: Watch this video to see how easy it is to make the navigation bar your own.

Title: You’re ready to go
Body: Remember to use the down arrow next to items in the navigation bar for recent items, favorites, and common actions.

MasterLabel: Lightning Experience - Work with Data Step 1
Title: Meet the new record layout
Body: Lightning Experience streamlines records by balancing things out across different tabs. This new approach cuts down on scrolling and makes it faster to find the desired information.

MasterLabel: Lightning Experience - Work with Data Step 2
Title: Close deals faster
Body: The Leads and Opportunities workspace is optimized for action and includes everything sales teams need to qualify and convert leads or close deals, like the Sales path.

MasterLabel: Lightning Experience - Work with Data Step 3
Title: Stay up to date on accounts
Body:
When you’re working with accounts and contacts, you want to find information fast. So these records are optimized for quick reference and at-a-glance insights.

  • See a summary of a record’s most important details at the top of the page in the highlights panel.
  • All of a record’s fields are grouped together on the Details tab.
  • Create new tasks, events, or emails and log calls on the Activities tab.
  • Collaborate with colleagues on the Chatter tab.

MasterLabel: Lightning Experience - Work with Data Step 4
Title: Related lists offer easy access
Body: The Related tab includes a collection of related list cards. Each card displays up to six records, so click View All to see more.

MasterLabel: Lightning Experience - Work with Data Step 5
Title: Learn more about records
Body: There’s more to learn about records, including customizing the related lists you see and performing custom actions from the record page.

MasterLabel: Lightning Experience - Work with List Views Step 1
Title: Get to know the power of list views
Body: List views are a great way to sort, prioritize, and analyze the records that are most important to you. Let’s take a look now.

MasterLabel: Lightning Experience - Work with List Views Step 2
Title: Change up your view
Body: Use the down arrow next to Recently Viewed to change your list view. Want a new default list to appear? Select a different list and pin it.

MasterLabel: Lightning Experience - Work with List Views Step 3
Title: See the whole picture
Body: Tired of seeing only part of each field in a list view? Click the down arrow in the column header and select Wrap text or Clip text.

MasterLabel: Lightning Experience - Work with List Views Step 4
Title: Make the list view your own
Body: Click the pencil icon on the right to update the included fields in your list. If you want to narrow your custom list view, click the funnel icon to add, modify, or remove filters.

MasterLabel: Lightning Experience - Work with List Views Step 5
Title: Explore more about list views
Body: Now that you know the basics, watch this short video to explore more about list views. Thanks for taking this tour with us!

MasterLabel: Get Help Anywhere in the Console App
Description: Tell users how to get help from anywhere in the console app
Title: Get Help Anywhere in the Console App
Body: To open the Help Menu, click the question mark. Find resources related to your work or search for answers to questions.

Description: Tell users how to customize the navigation in the Sales Console app.
Title: Customize Your Console Navigation
Body: You can add, remove, and reorder navigation items at any time.
